np: Has anyone tried Gnash? Did they have problems with Macromedia/Adobe Flash since?
is that how you start the gdm lets say if you dont go directly to the logon screen?
Yes, it makes any temporary files it needs to (better than typing "sudo gdm")
You cannot do that in a GUI though, as it will stop but not start again because the GUI telling it what to do is gone (use stop and start for that)
Use start instead of restart if it is not already running

That is a backup file
You do not see them in Nautilus (just like ones beginning in ".") but they are usually made by text editors
so i can get to it as well. is this a safety feature
The directory "~" is shorthand for your home (like capgadget said) but files ending in ~ are backups made by text editors and things, not system backups.
yea ending in ~ is backup thats what im wondering,
They are not system backups, so you can delete them. They are just incase you edit a file and want the original back. If you know you don't then just delete them
oh ok, nice to have that feature
